values: Ambulatory older subjects who are not nursing home residents
Subjects with acute infection (fever and symptoms within 2 weeks of enrollment)
Taking 10mg or more of  Prednisone daily for at least one month
Have illnesses such polymyalgia rheumatica, rheumatoid arthritis, and systemic lupus erythematosus, and at least for the latter two illnesses

Taking other drugs considered in immunosuppression in addition to Prednisone such as plaquenil, sulfasalzine, methotrexate, immuran, cytoxan, tacrolimus, mycophenolate mofetil, other chemotherapeutic agents and other  chemotherapeutic agents
Malignancy other than localized skin cancer subjects

creators.name: Innate Immune Responsiveness in the Elderly and the Immunosuppressed

values.value: This proposal will explore the hypothesis that altered innate immune responses in the elderly and the immunosuppressed contribute to vaccine unresponsiveness and disease susceptibility.  We will first (Aim 1) assess the levels of TLR expression and the efficiency of TLR responsiveness in younger adults versus elderly or immunosuppressed populations. In addition, we will assess the effect of aging on macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF), a TLR-responsive mediator that critically regulates monocyte/macrophage activation responses and downstream cytokine production.  We will then (Aim 2) assess the effects of these impairments in innate immunity, identified in Aim 1, on the efficiency of the response to Biodefense priority pathogens, using West Nile virus infection and influenza vaccination as models. These studies will lead to a greater understanding of how alterations in innate immune responses in high-risk populations such as in the elderly and the immunosuppressed contribute to disease susceptibility and vaccine responsiveness.  Understanding of these mechanisms of impaired host defense will be of general benefit, particularly given the potential for the emergence of new pathogens or outbreaks (including the widened range of mosquito vectors harboring West Nile virus in the United States) or the engineering of virulent or drug resistant agents for bioterorrism.  http://projectreporter.nih.gov/project_info_details.cfm?aid=7337892&icde=23814545&ddparam=&ddvalue=&ddsub=&cr=1&csb=default&cs=ASC

availability: Available for download after registration with ImmPort

dimensions.description: Examine the cytokine levels from supernatants of unstimulated and stimulated monocytes. After 20 hours stimulation with TLR ligands, the culture supernatants are assayed for IL-8 by ELISA. TLR stimulation: N-Palmitoyl-S-[2,3-bis(palmitoyloxy)-(2RS)-propyl]-[R]-Cys-[S]-Serl-[S]-Lys(4) trihydrochloride (Pam3CSK4 5 ug/ml; TLR1/2), Lipoteichoic acid (LTA; 1 ug/ml; TLR2/6), Lipopolysaccharide (LPS, 0.5 ug/ml; TLR4) and Flagellin from Salmonella typhimurium (2.5 ug/ml; TLR5) will be used.

Examine the cytokine levels from supernatants of unstimulated and stimulated monocytes. After 20 hours stimulation with TLR ligands, the culture supernatants are assayed for TNF-alpha by ELISA. TLR stimulation: N-Palmitoyl-S-[2,3-bis(palmitoyloxy)-(2RS)-propyl]-[R]-Cys-[S]-Serl-[S]-Lys(4) trihydrochloride (Pam3CSK4 5 ug/ml; TLR1/2), Lipoteichoic acid (LTA; 1 ug/ml; TLR2/6), Lipopolysaccharide (LPS, 0.5 ug/ml; TLR4) and Flagellin from Salmonella typhimurium (2.5 ug/ml; TLR5) will be used.

Monocytes/macrophages cells from adult, elderly, and immunosuppressed subjects, define their MIF genotype, and analyze their baseline and stimulus-induced production of MIF. Patient samples for genotyping will be obtained from the pellet of the Ficoll-hypaque isolation of PBMCs and extracted DNA will be analyzed for MIF genotype by established, robotic methodology that requires < 1 ug of DNA (Genes Immun 3:170-176). Purified monocytes/macrophage then will be studied for their baseline and stimulation-induced responses following protocols in place in our laboratory. We will define the MIF genotype (low versus high expression MIF alleles) in the adult, elderly, and immunosuppressed subjects, and determine whether any deviation in MIF production or MIF-dependent activation parameters (TLR expression, downstream pro-inflammatory cytokine production) is associated with particular MIF alleles.

Monocytes/macrophages cells from adult, elderly, and immunosuppressed subjects, define their MIF genotype, and analyze their baseline and stimulus-induced production of MIF. Patient samples for genotyping will be obtained from the pellet of the Ficoll-hypaque isolation of PBMCs and extracted DNA will be analyzed for MIF genotype by established, robotic methodology that requires < 1 ug of DNA (Genes Immun 3:170-176). Purified monocytes/macrophage then will be studied for their baseline and stimulation-induced responses following protocols in place in our laboratory. We will define the MIF genotype (low versus high expression MIF alleles) in the adult, elderly, and immunosuppressed subjects, and determine whether any deviation in MIF production or MIF-dependent activation parameters (TLR expression, downstream pro-inflammatory cytokine production) is associated with particular MIF alleles.

Examine the cytokine levels from supernatants of unstimulated and stimulated monocytes. After 20 hours stimulation with TLR ligands, the culture supernatants are assayed for MIF by ELISA. TLR stimulation: N-Palmitoyl-S-[2,3-bis(palmitoyloxy)-(2RS)-propyl]-[R]-Cys-[S]-Serl-[S]-Lys(4) trihydrochloride (Pam3CSK4 5 ug/ml; TLR1/2), Lipoteichoic acid (LTA; 1 ug/ml; TLR2/6), Lipopolysaccharide (LPS, 0.5 ug/ml; TLR4) and Flagellin from Salmonella typhimurium (2.5 ug/ml; TLR5) will be used.
Examine cell surface expression of TLR1, TLR2, TLR4, TLR5 and TLR6 by FACS staining.  Monocytes will be gated for CD4 dim population

To determine the mechanism of any impairment detected in TLR signaling, selected subjects will be sampled again for assay of signaling mechanisms. We will compare the induction of these factors, from monocytes of adult and elderly subjects in response to stimulation with TLR ligand. Adherent monocytes will be stimulated with TLR ligands for 10 min. Cell lysates from 1 x10e6 cells/well in 6 well plates will be assayed by standard assays.  Cells will then be lysed for Western Blot analysis to examine total and phosphorylated levels of NF-kB p65, p38, ERK, and IkBa.
Examine mRNA expression of TLRs1-9 by Q-PCR in human monocytes and blood DCs
Examine mRNA expression of TLRs1-9 by Q-PCR in human monocytes and blood DCs
Examine age-related differences in surface TLR expression in dendritic cells by FACS.
Examine cell surface expression of TLRs1-9 by FACS staining and the costimulatory molecules, CD80 and CD86

distributions.title: Delineate innate immune responses in populations at risk (the elderly and the immunosuppressed) that are different from the general population

acknowledges.name: Innate Immune Responsiveness in the Elderly and the Immunosuppressed

description:
We will assess the efficiency of the immune response of monocytes and dendritic cells in different populations (young adult and elderly) in response to stimulation with specific TLR ligands. We will focus separately on TLRs 3, 7, 8, 9, that recognize viral targets, TLRs 1, 2, 4, 6 (bacterial targets), and the effects of aging on MIF.

We will quantify TLR expression as well as efficiency of signaling pathways triggered by TLR engagement to identify mechanisms that contribute to the impairments of innate immunity associated with aging and immunosuppression.

Finally, we will assess the functional and genetic polymorphisms of MIF in the innate response to TLR stimulation.
